definition: to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on

sentences.english: These days the little Coyotes are now quire big, and love to sleep late.
sentences.chinese: 现如今幼狼们都长大了，喜欢赖床。

sentences.english: Snuggle together in bed on a cold Sunday morning.
sentences.chinese: 在一个寒冷的周日早晨大家一起赖床。

sentences.english: Tom chose to sleep in after staying up late the night before.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆由于昨晚熬夜，所以赖床了。

sentences.english: An important reason for too long is 2 nap kids getting up in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 2午睡过久也是小朋友早上赖床的一个重要原因。

sentences.english: Are you uninhibited in bed, more than three times a week, up for being experimental?
sentences.chinese: 你是否曾一周赖床三次以上，具有试验精神？

sentences.english: This contraption will ensure you understand the literal cost of your morning laziness.
sentences.chinese: 这个精巧的设计将确保你了解早上赖床的具体成本。

sentences.english: On the weekends, many people like to sleep in.
sentences.chinese: 周末有很多人喜欢赖床。

sentences.english: I hope I can depend on bed with you every day.
sentences.chinese: 我希望每天都能和你一起赖床。

definition: to get out of bed/to get up
grumpiness associated with poor sleep/irritability in the morning
early to bed, early to rise/to keep early hours
quilt wrapped around the body as a tube (traditional bedding)/(contemporary) bedding/quilt/blankets/cover/bed
